title: Quick Gameplay Thoughts: Feb 16
body:
Hi folks,

Figured I'd try something different for the next week or so and, when I've got a bit of forum time, spend a chunk of it putting together a quick post about some of the things we're currently thinking about or working on. These posts won't be comprehensive, or go into all the details, but are instead an experiment in getting quick updates out regularly. Feedback on the format appreciated.

So, some thoughts for today:

**7.5**

* We've been doing some balance planning for patch 7.5 in the last couple of days. Particularly noteworthy targets include likely nerfs to Edge of Night and Varus and continuation of work on Fizz and Blade of the Ruined King that wasn't ready in time for 7.4.

**Practice Tool**

* In addition to its other benefits practice tool has also resulted in some really comprehensive bug reports from some players which is highly appreciated. Player investigation into an MF bug that cropped up in ESports recently for example made getting a fix in for that much quicker and smoother than it would otherwise have been (we didn't have to spend anywhere near as much time digging into exactly what was going on and could get to finding a solution quicker). 

**Defensive Items**

* We're currently testing taking a moderate amount of power amount out of defensive stats on items (Health, MR, Armor) and adding some of that to base stats on Vanguards, Wardens and Juggernauts at least (possibly some others if testing goes well, to be determined). Goal there is to make it so those classes that need to be a certain level of tankiness to function in the first place get to that point more consistently, while also not becoming close to immortal if they get too large a lead. Showing some promise and some potential problems, but definitely looks worth further testing as a possible mid-season change.


**Non gameplay: Zaun stories**

* I'm a bit behind, but finally got round to reading through a bunch of the Zaun stories that went up on the Universe site recently. For anyone interested in that side of things I'd particularly recommend checking out the Mundo piece, really enjoyed that one despite a lack of previous interest in Mundo thematically: 

http://universe.leagueoflegends.com/en_PH/story/drmundo-color-story/

Please don't give Varus{{champion:110}}  the Sejuani{{champion:113}} +Cinderhulk{{item:1401}}  treatment. Varus is only broken right now because of how ridiculous lethality is. His ADC build was fine, as well as his other offbuilds. Before the lethality buffs, caster Varus wasn't even in a good spot. 
All I ask is that you see that Lethality and the items({{item:3142}} {{item:3814}} ) are the problem, and not Varus.

100% On board with this concern. I'm not a Varus player, but I've watched what happened to Master Yi with old Guinsoos+Devourer and other on hit characters. The result was silly when it was very obvious what the real problem was and it was with the items, not the champions. Now Master Yi had to get buffed for the first time in years after his rework when reverting his and other champion's changes would've sufficed perfectly fine.

I don't understand what the balancing teams seem to hate about reverting changes if they screw up. I've seen it in games besides LoL and really don't think it should be as strong of a train of thought if the teams are constantly overlooking what the actual problems are to begin with. Pride > balance amirite

PLEEEEEASE LISTEN TO THIS! Varus is ONLY strong right now because of lethality! People are ONLY complaining about the lethality build, before the buffs no one paid attention to Varus. Please don't give him the Sejuani treatment. PLEASE!

I cannot agree more with this. Varus was fine BEFORE the lethality buffs!

Also, to people like me - PLEASE DON'T TOUCH AP VARUS!!!

Even without Lethality Varus was the guy that chunks you for 50% of your HP from 2 screens away. Lethality does make it more reliable and happen earlier but I don't think a 2 second cooldown ability should deal that kind of damage.

Before the last 3 patches, Varus was statistically one of the least banned champs in the entire game, which implies that he was the least threatening/least frustrating champ in the game. 
Nobody ever complained about Varus beforehand, his Q is what makes Varus, Varus. That's like complaining that the strength of every champion "shouldn't be there."

I honestly think % Pen is an issue currently.
It's current state results in Tanks feeling overwhelming to face during the midgame, but once folks get to buy their % pen items, Tanks (And JuggerNoots) will feel underwhelming to play.

Is this something you guys are looking into for the mid season update?

Generally with you on the contrast between mid game and late game being too large, and both sometimes feeling out of line (in opposite ways). Talking about options there, nothing concrete enough to share though.
how about asphalt

Glad to hear that edge of night is going to be looked at, and varus as well. How do you guys feel about Miss Fortune's state right now? She seems extremely strong with lethality.
Potentially too strong, or at least too much power focused specifically in Q2. Unsure if we'll make changes, she's on a list of champs to be assessed during 7.5. development though.

In my humble opinion, I believe balance work aimed at MF should pull some power away from her ultimate into other parts of her kit. She is the queen of wombo combo certainly, but is it really okay that her entire gameplay focuses so much on her getting a good ult off, to the point that it actually distorts her build aswell? Her mini-game of switching targets constantly in a fight to optimise DPS looks very fun and makes her sort of unique.

Do you believe that the lethality buff was a bit too much? The ADCs abusing it just make it particularly obvious but really anyone who can use it has become overpowered. I was happy when I heard lethality was getting buffed but I think the knob just got cranked a little too far.

Meddler, is it that she is too strong or is it that lethality is just a terrible stat on AD casters?  Jhin abuses it too.

IMO make the stat melee only and the problems are solved.

AD assassins to have ranged abilities that need to reliably use Lethality... and I'm not even an assassin (or mid) main. I main support.

Honestly, I feel that supports just need help in actually PEELING the damage... and then you have assassins running around with a frickin' _spellshield_ in Edge of Night, which is likely to be built earlier now after Ghostblade nerfs, which is going to make supports' jobs harder.

Unsure, this is still early and quite experimental work. Most likely all items with defensive stats, possible some exceptions, or different changes, for items intended to be defensive choices on characters otherwise going mainly offense or utility.

Any thoughts on Crit/AA-based ADCs?

I understand the ideas behind 'lower defensive stats on items, increase them on champs', but I worry that this will merely result in defense scaling even worse than it currently does.  If I get even less, statwise, out of getting a kill on rammus than my midlaner, it'll mean that any kills I do take is a mistake.

Why not change Lethality to 50/50 scaling from 60/40 scaling? The problem with Lethality is that it gives too much in the earlygame, making the trade off of AD non relevant (AD is suppose to be for earlygame, pen for lategame). And does Varus need nerfs? If Lethality and its items are finaly balanced, I think Varus will also be balanced becuz he is just an abuser.

>Defensive Items

>We're currently testing taking a moderate amount of power amount out of defensive stats on items (Health, MR, Armor) and adding some of that to base stats on Vanguards, Wardens and Juggernauts at least (possibly some others if testing goes well, to be determined). Goal there is to make it so those classes that need to be a certain level of tankiness to function in the first place get to that point more consistently, while also not becoming close to immortal if they get too large a lead. Showing some promise and some potential problems, but definitely looks worth further testing as a possible mid-season change.

Won't this lead to them just building offence and saying "fuck it, I'm tanky enough at base"?
Wouldn't just upping Tanky champion's base stats and lowering the tankiness of items result in them just, well, buying damage?

This is a very interesting idea, but, why is riot so open about their thoughts now? We have dev blogs, the Nexus page, dev diaries on YouTube, it's super refreshing to see. But why has it taken this long to do these things? Have you only recently decided that telling players about the inner workings is worth doing?(sorry if this potentially seems antagonistic, it's not supposed to be, honestly!)

Riot learned their lesson from the ridiculous insane amount of negative feedback they received from the Lee Sin rework. Since then they have tried to be more and more transparent so no one is overtly shocked just before something goes on the PBE (because by that point Riot is usually determined to ship it and having to scrap the whole thing is a huge waste of resources).

> Figured I'd try something different for the next week or so and, when I've got a bit of forum time, spend a chunk of it putting together a quick post about some of the things we're currently thinking about or working on. These posts won't be comprehensive, or go into all the details, but are instead an experiment in getting quick updates out regularly. Feedback on the format appreciated.

The format sounds good. I mean, in the end if moobeat and/or the Red Tracker do their job of centralizing the relevant information correctly, it's kinda the same thing as before, but it's probably better to have some "standard" way to communicate with us players than to rely on surr@20. Btw, even if you're not directly concerned, this is a good opportunity to signal that for a couple months, Red Tracker is kinda flooded by individual answers from Support and/or Bug Reports, so it lost a large amount of its initial usefulness (at least to me).

> In addition to its other benefits practice tool has also resulted in some really comprehensive bug reports from some players which is highly appreciated.

Of course hindsight is 20/20, but it seems kinda obvious to me that this kind of things would happen... Does it really come out as a surprise to Rioters?

___

On the specific topics of today's post: the only thing relevant to me is defensive itemization. The path you're talking about seems good, but if this is linked to mid-season, why not go for something more drastic, like putting %amp on defensive items the same way it's currently done for some offensive items? Spellblade or Sterak have %baseAD, AS items also works with % of base. Why not make some Armor items give +X% of base Armor in addition to or instead of flat amounts?
